questions.question: What notable UNESCO site in South America is renowned for its Inca stone architecture and mysterious purpose, perched on a mountain ridge?
questions.context: This ancient city was built in the 15th century and remained unknown to the outside world until discovered by Hiram Bingham in 1911.

questions.question: Where is the historical site of one of the largest battles in World War II, known for its strategic significance and the turning point it marked on the Eastern Front?
questions.context: The Battle of Stalingrad lasted from August 1942 to February 1943 and is often cited as one of the bloodiest battles in the history of warfare.

questions.question: What is the renowned dark tourism site in Poland, symbolizing the horrors of the Holocaust during World War II?
questions.context: This site was the largest of the Nazi concentration and extermination camps and serves as a powerful reminder of the atrocities committed.

questions.question: In which city would you find the modern architectural marvel known as the Burj Khalifa, recognized as the tallest building in the world?
questions.context: Completed in 2010, the Burj Khalifa stands at a staggering height of 828 meters and is a symbol of the futuristic architectural landscape of the region.

questions.question: What ancient ruin in Cambodia is the largest religious monument in the world, originally constructed as a Hindu temple dedicated to the god Vishnu?
questions.context: Built in the early 12th century, Angkor Wat later transformed into a Buddhist temple and is celebrated for its grandeur and intricate bas-reliefs.
